original: rnag sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgrar //
analyzed: rnag sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgrar //
translated: The word ‚ÄúBuddha‚Äù is explained

original: byang chub sems dpa' rab tu bstan //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rab tu bstan //
translated: as the Bodhisattva.

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is stated extensively.

original: de bas na theg pa thams cad ni theg pa gcig la zhugs pa yin @270a * //üîΩpas na / theg pa gcig gi 'bras bur gnas //
analyzed: de bas na theg pa thams cad ni theg pa gcig la zhugs pa yin @270a * // pas na / theg pa gcig gi 'bras bur gnas //
translated: Therefore, since all vehicles are included in one vehicle,üîΩit is said, ‚ÄúOne abides in the result of the one vehicle.‚Äù

original: zhes bya'o // nyon mongs khams rnams dag pa'i bdag / ces bya ba la /üîΩnyon mongs pa rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa ni /üîΩnyon mongs pa'i khams te /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // nyon mongs khams rnams dag pa'i bdag / ces bya ba la / nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa ni / nyon mongs pa'i khams te /
translated: The self of the pure element of afflictionsüîΩis the cause of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rigs so //
translated: The element of afflictions is the family of afflictions.üîΩIt is also explained as follows:

original: de yang / spungs dang skye sgo rigs kyi don //
analyzed: de yang / spungs dang skye sgo rigs kyi don //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúaggregate,‚Äù ‚Äúsource,‚Äù and ‚Äúelement‚Äù

original: phung po skye mched khams rnams so //üîΩzhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po skye mched khams rnams so // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is the aggregates, sources, and elements.

original: de yang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum ste /
translated: The three roots of nonvirtue are attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: 'di dag ni rang nyid kyang mi dge ba'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rang nyid kyang mi dge ba'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: These are themselves the nature of nonvirtue.

original: mi dge ba gzhan rnams kyi yang rtsa bar 'gyur ba yin pas mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba gzhan rnams kyi yang rtsa bar 'gyur ba yin pas mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are also the roots of other nonvirtues, they are called the roots of nonvirtue.

original: de rnams rnam par dag pas chos thams cad bdag med par mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams rnam par dag pas chos thams cad bdag med par mthong ba ste /
translated: By their purification, one sees that all phenomena are selfless.

original: des rtsa ba ma lus par drungs nas phyung bas nyon mongs pa'i khams rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid 'ba' zhig gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: des rtsa ba ma lus par drungs nas phyung bas nyon mongs pa'i khams rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid 'ba' zhig gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Since that [wisdom] completely uproots them, the nature of the complete purification of the element of afflictions

original: nyon mongs khams rnams dag pa'i bdag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs khams rnams dag pa'i bdag / ces bya ba la /
translated: is the nature of the purification of the element of afflictions.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa rnams kyi khams ni rang bzhin dang ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa rnams kyi khams ni rang bzhin dang ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to /
translated: Or, the element of afflictions means their nature and essence.

original: rang bzhin gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is their nature?

original: chos thams cad dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rnag bzhin ni gdod ma nas ma skyes pa yin pas na rnag bzhin rnam par dag pa'i bdag yid kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //üîΩlas kyi khams rnams zad byed pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rnag bzhin ni gdod ma nas ma skyes pa yin pas na rnag bzhin rnam par dag pa'i bdag yid kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o // las kyi khams rnams zad byed pa /
translated: The nature of all phenomena and afflictions is primordially unborn, so the nature of the purification of that nature is the nature of the mind.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the one that causes the exhaustion of the element of karma.

original: las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems ni las kyi khams so //
analyzed: las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems ni las kyi khams so //
translated: The mind that motivates all virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral actions is the action element.

original: bdag dang bdag gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa bskyed pa la mngon par zhen pa las de 'bung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa bskyed pa la mngon par zhen pa las de 'bung bar 'gyur la /
translated: It is generated from the attachment to the generation of the apprehended and the apprehender as ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: phyin ci log de skyed par byed pa'i las kyi khams kun du bskyed pa yang skye ba med pa'i chos can du bstan pas na /
analyzed: phyin ci log de skyed par byed pa'i las kyi khams kun du bskyed pa yang skye ba med pa'i chos can du bstan pas na /
translated: The generation of the action element that generates that error is also taught to be a phenomenon that is not generated.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: las kyi khams rnams zad byed pa //
analyzed: las kyi khams rnams zad byed pa //
translated: ‚ÄúThe exhaustion of the action elements.‚Äù

original: zhes bya'o // chu bo rgya mtsho kun las brgal //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // chu bo rgya mtsho kun las brgal // zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúCrossing over all rivers and oceans‚Äù means

original: chu bo ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: chu bo ni bzhi ste /
translated: The rivers are four:

original: 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo'o //
translated: the river of desire, the river of existence, the river of views, and the river of ignorance.

original: de yang sems can rnams kyi legs par phrogs pas na chu bo ste /
analyzed: de yang sems can rnams kyi legs par phrogs pas na chu bo ste /
translated: They are called ‚Äúrivers‚Äù because they carry sentient beings away.

original: chu bo'i chu bo dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: chu bo'i chu bo dang 'dra'o //
translated: They are like the water of a river.

original: chu bo de ni rgal dka' ba'i phyir rgya mtsho dang 'dra bas na rgyas mtsho'o //
analyzed: chu bo de ni rgal dka' ba'i phyir rgya mtsho dang 'dra bas na rgyas mtsho'o //
translated: The river is like an ocean because it is difficult to cross, so it is an ocean.

original: de las yang dag par kun du brgal ba ni rnam pa thams cad du pha rol tu byon pas slar mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de las yang dag par kun du brgal ba ni rnam pa thams cad du pha rol tu byon pas slar mi ldog pa'o //
translated: Having crossed over it, one has gone to the other shore in every way, so one does not return.

original: sbyor ba'i dgon pa las byung ba //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dgon pa las byung ba //
translated: Having emerged from the wilderness of the fetters,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the above,

original: sbyor ba ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni bzhi ste /
translated: there are four fetters:

original: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang / @270b srid pa'i sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang / @270b srid pa'i sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: the fetter of desire, the fetter of existence, the fetter of views, and the fetter of ignorance.

original: sbyor ba de rnams ni shin tu 'jigs su rung bas na dgon pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba de rnams ni shin tu 'jigs su rung bas na dgon pa'o //
translated: Those fetters are a wilderness because they are extremely frightening.

original: de rnams las byung ba ni nges bar mthong ba ste /üîΩdes na / sbyar ba'i dgon pa las byung ba //
analyzed: de rnams las byung ba ni nges bar mthong ba ste / des na / sbyar ba'i dgon pa las byung ba //
translated: Having emerged from them, one has seen the truth.üîΩTherefore,

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúHaving emerged from the wilderness of the fetters.üîΩ‚Äù

original: des pa'i tshig bi yang khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye ngas dang / sa rnams su sbyor zhing sems can rnams chu bor lhung bar 'gyur bas na sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des pa'i tshig bi yang khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye ngas dang / sa rnams su sbyor zhing sems can rnams chu bor lhung bar 'gyur bas na sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The word fetter is used because the realms, destinies, births, and stages fetter sentient beings and cause them to fall into the river.

original: nyon mongs nye ba'i kun nyon mongs //
analyzed: nyon mongs nye ba'i kun nyon mongs //
translated: The afflictions and the secondary afflictions,

original: bag chags bcas par gtan spangs pa //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bag chags bcas par gtan spangs pa // zhes bya ba la /
translated: along with their instincts, are completely abandoned.

original: de la nyon mongs pa ni dgu bcu rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa ni dgu bcu rtsa brgyad do //
translated: Here, the afflictions are the eighty-eight.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang de nyid de /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang de nyid de /
translated: The secondary afflictions are also those.

original: de rnams mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas par phye nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas par phye nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: They are taught in brief and in detail.

original: de la kun du sbyor ba dgu ste /
analyzed: de la kun du sbyor ba dgu ste /
translated: There are nine fetters:

original: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / ser sna dang / phrag dog go //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / ser sna dang / phrag dog go //
translated: attachment, hostility, pride, ignorance, false view, adherence, doubt, envy, and selfishness.

original: de la khams gsum gyi 'dod chags zhen pa'i mtshan nyid rgya skyegs zhu bar sbyar blta bu'i chos ni rjes chags pa ste /
analyzed: de la khams gsum gyi 'dod chags zhen pa'i mtshan nyid rgya skyegs zhu bar sbyar blta bu'i chos ni rjes chags pa ste /
translated: Attachment is the fetter that is the characteristic of the desire for the three realms, like the application of lac-dye.

original: rjes su chags pa nyid kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa nyid kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: Attachment is itself a fetter.

original: sems can rnams la gnod cing gsod pa'i mtshan nyid can sa ban kha ba lta bu'i chos ni khong khro ba ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la gnod cing gsod pa'i mtshan nyid can sa ban kha ba lta bu'i chos ni khong khro ba ste /
translated: Hostility is the fetter that is the characteristic of harming and killing sentient beings, like a thorn.

original: khong khro ba nyid kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: khong khro ba nyid kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: Anger is a fetter.

original: bdag dang gzhan du nye bar btags nas sems mtho ba'i mtshan nyid can du skyes bu rengs pa lta bu ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du nye bar btags nas sems mtho ba'i mtshan nyid can du skyes bu rengs pa lta bu ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: Pride is the swelling up of the mind due to the false notion of superiority in regard to one's own caste, etc., and in regard to others.

original: de yang rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bdun te /
translated: It has seven varieties:üîΩpride, excessive pride,üîΩthe pride of the idea of me,üîΩthe pride of superiority,üîΩthe pride of inferiority,

original: nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: and false pride.

original: de la nga rgyal ni chung du bas bdag rus dang / rigs dang / gzugs dang / nor dang / thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzo la sogs pa dag gis bye brag tu 'phags pa'am /
analyzed: de la nga rgyal ni chung du bas bdag rus dang / rigs dang / gzugs dang / nor dang / thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzo la sogs pa dag gis bye brag tu 'phags pa'am /
translated: Pride is the swelling up of the mind due to the false notion of superiority in regard to one's own caste, etc., and in regard to others.

original: rus la sogs pa 'dra ba dang mtshungs so snyam pa de'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems kyi rlom sems de ni nga rgyal bzhes bya'o // che ba'i nga rgyal ni mtshungs pa bas bdag rus la sogs pa dag gis bye brag tu 'phags pa'am /üîΩche ba dang mtshungs so snyam pa des drangs pa'i sems khengs pa ni che ba'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: rus la sogs pa 'dra ba dang mtshungs so snyam pa de'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems kyi rlom sems de ni nga rgyal bzhes bya'o // che ba'i nga rgyal ni mtshungs pa bas bdag rus la sogs pa dag gis bye brag tu 'phags pa'am / che ba dang mtshungs so snyam pa des drangs pa'i sems khengs pa ni che ba'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Pride is the mental activity of self-satisfaction that arises from the cause of thinking that one is equal to or superior to others in terms of social class, etc.üîΩExaggerated pride is the mental activity of self-satisfaction that arises from the cause of thinking that one is equal to or superior to those who are equal or superior to oneself in terms of social class, etc.

original: nga rgyal la kyang nga rgyal ni che bas kyang bdag ches che'o snyam pa des drangs pa'i sems khengs pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal la kyang nga rgyal ni che bas kyang bdag ches che'o snyam pa des drangs pa'i sems khengs pa'o //
translated: Pride of pride is the mental activity of self-satisfaction that arises from the cause of thinking that one is superior to those who are superior to oneself.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni bdag tu lta ba'i rjes las byung ba'i sems khengs ba'o //üîΩmngon pa'i nga rgyal ni rgyun @271a * //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni bdag tu lta ba'i rjes las byung ba'i sems khengs ba'o // mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni rgyun @271a * //
translated: Pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is the mental activity of self-satisfaction that arises from the view of the transitory composite.

original: du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa gong ma'i khyad par thob par bya ba ma thob par bdag gis thob po snyam pa de'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems kyi rlom sems so //
analyzed: du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa gong ma'i khyad par thob par bya ba ma thob par bdag gis thob po snyam pa de'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems kyi rlom sems so //
translated: Arrogance is the mental activity of self-satisfaction that arises from the cause of thinking that one has attained the special results of the stages of spiritual development, such as the stage of entry into the stream, etc., when one has not yet attained them.

original: cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni rigs la sogs pa khyad par ches 'phags pa bdag cung zad cig gis chung bar blta zhing des rlom sems pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni rigs la sogs pa khyad par ches 'phags pa bdag cung zad cig gis chung bar blta zhing des rlom sems pa'o //
translated: The pride of thinking I am a little is to think I am a little inferior to those who are very superior in caste, etc., and to be conceited by that.

original: log pa'i da rgyal ni yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan par blta zhing des rlom sems pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i da rgyal ni yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan par blta zhing des rlom sems pa'o //
translated: The pride of wrong position is to think I am endowed with good qualities and to be conceited by that.

original: nga rgyal bdun po 'di dag ni nga rgyal gyis kun du sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal bdun po 'di dag ni nga rgyal gyis kun du sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: These seven kinds of pride are called the fetter of pride.

original: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum po'i mi shes pa mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid long ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum po'i mi shes pa mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid long ba lta bu ste /
translated: As for ignorance, it is the non-knowing of the three realms, characterized by non-understanding, like blindness.

original: rig pa'i gnyen po ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnyen po ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The antidote to knowledge is called ignorance.

original: dag pa ni gnyen po la gzhag pa'i phyir mi mdzad pa dang / mi bden pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dag pa ni gnyen po la gzhag pa'i phyir mi mdzad pa dang / mi bden pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is not made because it is established in the antidote, like purity, non-action, and so on.

original: ma rig pa nyid kun du sbyor ba ni ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa nyid kun du sbyor ba ni ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: The fetter of ignorance is the fetter of ignorance itself.

original: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa dang log par lta ba gsum ni lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa dang log par lta ba gsum ni lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: The fetters of the three views of the transitory collection, extreme views, and wrong views are the fetter of views.

original: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po bdag med pa bdag gi med pa rnams la bdag dang bdag gi tshul gyis zhugs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi blo ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po bdag med pa bdag gi med pa rnams la bdag dang bdag gi tshul gyis zhugs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi blo ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: The afflicted view of the self is the thought that the five aggregates appropriated, which are devoid of self and devoid of mine, are the self and the mine.

original: de ni 'jig pa yang yin la tshogs kyang yin pas 'jig tshogs bo //
analyzed: de ni 'jig pa yang yin la tshogs kyang yin pas 'jig tshogs bo //
translated: It is the perishable collection because it is a collection that perishes.

original: de la lta bas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la lta bas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: It is the view of the perishable collection because it views the perishable collection.

original: chad pa ma yin pa rtag pa ma yin pa de dag nyid la chad pa dang / rtag pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi blo ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba ste /
analyzed: chad pa ma yin pa rtag pa ma yin pa de dag nyid la chad pa dang / rtag pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi blo ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba ste /
translated: The extreme view is the afflicted thought that those things that are not eternal are eternal and those things that are not annihilated are annihilated.

original: mtha' gnyis su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the extreme view because it engages the two extremes.

original: las med do //
analyzed: las med do //
translated: There is no karma.

original: las kyi 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu med do //
translated: There is no result of karma.

original: thar pa med do //
analyzed: thar pa med do //
translated: There is no liberation.üîΩThere is no path that leads to liberation.

original: de thob par byed pa'i lam yang med do snyam du de ltar dngos po yod pa yang dag par 'jig par zhugs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi blo gang yin pa de ni log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i lam yang med do snyam du de ltar dngos po yod pa yang dag par 'jig par zhugs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi blo gang yin pa de ni log par lta ba'o //
translated: Wrong view is the afflicted thought that engages in the complete negation of existent things.

original: lta ba gsum po de dag ni lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba gsum po de dag ni lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: These three views are the fetter of views.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis po lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis po lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: The two clingings, the clinging to false views and the clinging to observances and rituals, are the fetter of clinging.

original: de la lta ba mchog tu ma yin pa de dag dang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po mchog ma yin pa rnams la mchog go snyam du mchog tu 'dzin pa'i blo'i bye brag gang yin pa de ni ltab mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de la lta ba mchog tu ma yin pa de dag dang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po mchog ma yin pa rnams la mchog go snyam du mchog tu 'dzin pa'i blo'i bye brag gang yin pa de ni ltab mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The clinging to false views is the special kind of mind that clings to the five aggregates of clinging as being the best, when they are not the best.

original: rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is a kind of conception.

original: tshul khrims ni 'chal @271b ba'i tshul khrims spangs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni 'chal @271b ba'i tshul khrims spangs pa'o //
translated: Observances and rituals are the avoidance of immorality.

original: brtul zhugs ni khyi dang / ri dgas dang / ba lang gi brtul zhugs dang / gcer bu dang / thab dang thal ba'i nang na nyal ba dang / skra 'bal ba dang 'bab stegs su 'khru ba dang / 'bras bu dang rtsa ba zab dang /
analyzed: brtul zhugs ni khyi dang / ri dgas dang / ba lang gi brtul zhugs dang / gcer bu dang / thab dang thal ba'i nang na nyal ba dang / skra 'bal ba dang 'bab stegs su 'khru ba dang / 'bras bu dang rtsa ba zab dang /
translated: Asceticism refers to the asceticisms of dogs, deer, and cows; nakedness; sleeping in the midst of ashes and embers; pulling out one's hair; bathing at fords; eating roots and fruits;

original: ral pa thogs pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ral pa thogs pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: holding a crest-jewel, and so on.

original: dag pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de gnyi ga la dag par yid ches pa'i blo'i bye brag bram ze'i cho ga can gtsang sbra 'dod pa lta bu'i chos gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de gnyi ga la dag par yid ches pa'i blo'i bye brag bram ze'i cho ga can gtsang sbra 'dod pa lta bu'i chos gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of those who are not pure but who believe in the purity of both of those, such as those who desire purity through the rites of the Brahmins, is the clinging to rules and ritual as supreme.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i gnyis po de dag ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i gnyis po de dag ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: These two clingings are the fetter of clinging to rules and ritual.

original: the tshom ni sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam zhes bya ba bden pa rnams la yid gnyis za ba las lam kha brag dang / rtsa mi 'dra ba'i chos nyid de /
analyzed: the tshom ni sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam zhes bya ba bden pa rnams la yid gnyis za ba las lam kha brag dang / rtsa mi 'dra ba'i chos nyid de /
translated: It is like a fork in the road, or like a forked road.

original: 'di sdug bsngal yin nam /
analyzed: 'di sdug bsngal yin nam /
translated: It is like thinking, Is this suffering?

original: 'di sdug bsngal ma yin snyam pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di sdug bsngal ma yin snyam pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Is this not suffering? and so on.

original: the tshom nyid kun du sbyor bas the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom nyid kun du sbyor bas the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: Doubt itself is a fetter, thus it is the fetter of doubt.

original: phrag dog ni pha rol gyi 'byor pa la mi bzod pa ste /üîΩpha rol po nor dang ldan nas /
analyzed: phrag dog ni pha rol gyi 'byor pa la mi bzod pa ste / pha rol po nor dang ldan nas /
translated: Jealousy is the inability to bear the good fortune of others.üîΩIt is the disturbance of the mind, thinking, That other person is wealthy,

original: mkhas nas bkur ba rnams la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas nas bkur ba rnams la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: learned, and respected, and so on.

original: phrag dog nyid kun du sbyor bas phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: phrag dog nyid kun du sbyor bas phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: Jealousy itself is a fetter, thus it is the fetter of jealousy.

original: dngos po 'di dag las gzhan la mi gtong ngo snyam du sems kyi kun du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni ser sna ste /
analyzed: dngos po 'di dag las gzhan la mi gtong ngo snyam du sems kyi kun du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni ser sna ste /
translated: Avarice is the grasping of the mind, thinking, I will not give anything away from these things.

original: de nyid kun du sbyor bas ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kun du sbyor bas ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: The fetter of avarice is the fetter that is the cause of avarice.

original: kun du sbyor ba'i don ni 'ching ba'i don te /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba'i don ni 'ching ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of fetter is the meaning of bondage.

original: ji skad du 'jig rten gyi mgon pos kyang /
analyzed: ji skad du 'jig rten gyi mgon pos kyang /
translated: As the Lord of the World says:

original: mig gzugs rnams la kun du mi sbyor la /
analyzed: mig gzugs rnams la kun du mi sbyor la /
translated: The eye is not fettered to forms,

original: gzugs rnams kyang mig la ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gzugs rnams kyang mig la ma yin mod kyi /
translated: and forms are not fettered to the eye.

original: de la 'dod pa la 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni 'dir kun du sbyor pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa la 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni 'dir kun du sbyor pa ste /
translated: However, the desire for them is the fetter here.

original: dper na ba lang nag po yang ba lang dkar po la kun du mi sbyor la /
analyzed: dper na ba lang nag po yang ba lang dkar po la kun du mi sbyor la /
translated: For example, a black cow is not fettered to a white cow,

original: ba lang dkar po yang ba lang nag po la ma yin no /
analyzed: ba lang dkar po yang ba lang nag po la ma yin no /
translated: and a white cow is not fettered to a black cow.

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus it is said extensively.

original: kun du sbyor ba rnams ni 'ching ba'i don yin pas kun du sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni 'ching ba yang yin mod kyi /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba rnams ni 'ching ba'i don yin pas kun du sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni 'ching ba yang yin mod kyi /
translated: Since the meaning of fetter is the meaning of bondage, whatever is a fetter is also a bondage.

original: 'on kyang gtso bor gyur ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdo las 'dod chags ni 'ching ba //
analyzed: 'on kyang gtso bor gyur ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdo las 'dod chags ni 'ching ba //
translated: However, because of being primary, attachment is said to be a fetter in the sutras of the Tathagata.

original: zhe sdang ni 'ching ba /
analyzed: zhe sdang ni 'ching ba /
translated: Aversion is a fetter.

original: gti mug ni 'ching ba zhes 'ching ba gsum gsungs te /
analyzed: gti mug ni 'ching ba zhes 'ching ba gsum gsungs te /
translated: The three fetters are called bondages.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid ni bshad zin @272a * //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid ni bshad zin @272a * //
translated: Their characteristics have already been explained.

original: to ; / phra rgyas ni bdun te /
analyzed: to ; / phra rgyas ni bdun te /
translated: There are seven proclivities:

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom gyi phra rgyas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom gyi phra rgyas so //
translated: the proclivities of attachment to pleasure, hostility, attachment to existence, pride, ignorance, views, and doubt.

original: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni kun du sbyor ba bsam pa'i skabs su bshad zin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni kun du sbyor ba bsam pa'i skabs su bshad zin te /
translated: Their characteristics have already been explained in the chapter on the fetters.

original: khams dang / tshul dang ; rnam pa'i bye brag de dbye bar bya'o //üîΩde la 'dod pa rnams la 'dod chags pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: khams dang / tshul dang ; rnam pa'i bye brag de dbye bar bya'o // de la 'dod pa rnams la 'dod chags pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: They should be distinguished by realm, type, and aspect.üîΩAttachment to pleasure is attachment to the desire realm.

original: de nyid phra rgyas yin pas 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas so //
analyzed: de nyid phra rgyas yin pas 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas so //
translated: Since it is a proclivity, it is the proclivity of attachment to the desire realm.

original: de la 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'dod chags sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas so //
analyzed: de la 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'dod chags sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas so //
translated: The proclivity of attachment to the desire realm is the proclivity of attachment to the desire realm that is abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation, which are the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i khong khrob lnga ni khong khro ba'i phra rgyas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i khong khrob lnga ni khong khro ba'i phra rgyas so //
translated: The proclivity of hostility is the five that are abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation, which are the truths of suffering and so on.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags bcu po sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas so //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags bcu po sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas so //
translated: The proclivity of attachment to existence is the ten attachments to the form and formless realms that are abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation, which are the truths of suffering and so on.

original: nang du bltas par gyur pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa rnams la thar par 'du shes pa bzlog pa'i phyir khams gnyis nas skyes pa'i 'dod chags ni srid pa'i 'dod chags so zhes bde bar gshegs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: nang du bltas par gyur pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa rnams la thar par 'du shes pa bzlog pa'i phyir khams gnyis nas skyes pa'i 'dod chags ni srid pa'i 'dod chags so zhes bde bar gshegs pas gsungs so //
translated: The Sugata said that attachment to the two realms is attachment to existence because it is attachment that turns inward and is the conception of liberation in the absorptions and formless states.

original: de bzhin du khams gsum pa'i nga rgyal bco lnga sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi phra rgyas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams gsum pa'i nga rgyal bco lnga sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi phra rgyas so //
translated: So too, the fifteen types of pride of the three realms that are objects to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation are the negative tendencies of pride.

original: ma rig pa'i phar rgyas kyang de bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i phar rgyas kyang de bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: So too, the negative tendencies of ignorance should be understood.

original: khams gsum pa'i lta ba sum cu rtsa drug po dag ni lta ba'i phra rgyas te /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i lta ba sum cu rtsa drug po dag ni lta ba'i phra rgyas te /
translated: The thirty six views of the three realms are the negative tendencies of view.

original: de la 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: de la 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /
translated: Among them, the afflicted view of the self, extreme view, wrong view that is abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, clinging to those views as paramount, and clinging to rules and ritual as paramount that are associated with the desire realm

original: kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'gog ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'gog ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang /
translated: Wrong view, holding a view as paramount, and overesteeming morality and asceticism that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of origin, cessation, and path,

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul @272b zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa de dag ni lta ba bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul @272b zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa de dag ni lta ba bcu gnyis so //
translated: are the twelve views.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i yang de bzhin te /
translated: The same is true of the form and formless realms.

original: lta ba sum cu rtsa drug po de dag ni lta ba'i phra rgyas so //
analyzed: lta ba sum cu rtsa drug po de dag ni lta ba'i phra rgyas so //
translated: These thirty six views are the negative tendencies of view.

original: khams gsum pa'i the tshom bcu gnyis ni the tshom gyi phra rgyas te /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i the tshom bcu gnyis ni the tshom gyi phra rgyas te /
translated: The twelve doubts of the three realms are the negative tendencies of doubt.

original: de la 'dod par gtogs pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas sbang bar bya ba bzhi dang / de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag go //
analyzed: de la 'dod par gtogs pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas sbang bar bya ba bzhi dang / de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag go //
translated: Four are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering and so on in the desire realm and likewise in the form and formless realms.

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba'i phra rgyas dag ni rnam pa tha dad pa nyid da //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba'i phra rgyas dag ni rnam pa tha dad pa nyid da //
translated: The proclivities of attachment to pleasure and hostility are distinct by their mode.

original: khams kyis ma yin /üîΩtshul gyis ma yin /
analyzed: khams kyis ma yin / tshul gyis ma yin /
translated: They are not distinct by their realm.üîΩThey are not distinct by their mode.

original: tshul gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul gyis ma yin no //
translated: They are not distinct by their mode.

original: srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas ni khams dang rnam pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas ni khams dang rnam pa ste /
translated: The proclivity of attachment to existence is distinct by its realm and by its mode.

original: tshul gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul gyis ma yin no //
translated: It is not distinct by its mode.

original: nga rgyal dang / ma rig dang / the tshom gyi phra rgyas kyang khams dang rnam pa ste tshul gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / ma rig dang / the tshom gyi phra rgyas kyang khams dang rnam pa ste tshul gyis ma yin no //
translated: The proclivities of pride, ignorance and doubt are distinct by their realm and by their mode.

original: lta ba'i phra rgyas ni khams dang / rnam pa dang / tshul gyi bye brag gis tha dad do //
analyzed: lta ba'i phra rgyas ni khams dang / rnam pa dang / tshul gyi bye brag gis tha dad do //
translated: The proclivities of afflicted view are distinct by their realm, by their mode and by their type.

original: de la lta ba rnams kyi khams dang / lta ba'i bye brag ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la lta ba rnams kyi khams dang / lta ba'i bye brag ni bshad zin to //
translated: The realm and the mode of the afflicted views have been explained.

original: tshul gyi bye brag ni ma bshad de brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul gyi bye brag ni ma bshad de brjod par bya'o //
translated: The type has not been explained; we will explain it.üîΩThe afflicted view of holding to an extreme is of two types:

original: de la bdag dang bdag gi tshul gyis zhugs pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la bdag dang bdag gi tshul gyis zhugs pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: The afflicted view of holding to an extreme is of two types:

original: chad pa dang rtag pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o //
analyzed: chad pa dang rtag pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o //
translated: The view of grasping extremes is the entry into the mode of annihilation and permanence.

original: med pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa ni log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: med pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa ni log par lta ba'o //
translated: Wrong view is the entry into the mode of nonexistence.

original: mchog gi tshul gyis zhugs pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mchog gi tshul gyis zhugs pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view grasping the extremes is the entry into the mode of the highest.

original: dag pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view grasping rules and ritual as paramount is the entry into the mode of purity.

original: phra rgyas kyi don ni phra rgyas kyi don to //
analyzed: phra rgyas kyi don ni phra rgyas kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of negative tendency is the meaning of negative tendency.

original: yang na las dang sems kyi rgyun gyi rjes su bsnyegs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na las dang sems kyi rgyun gyi rjes su bsnyegs pa ste /
translated: Or they are called negative tendencies because they pursue the continuum of karma and mind.

original: chu la rgyu bas nam mkha' la rgyu ba'i grib ma la bsnyegs pa lta bu'i phyir phra rgyas so //
analyzed: chu la rgyu bas nam mkha' la rgyu ba'i grib ma la bsnyegs pa lta bu'i phyir phra rgyas so //
translated: They are negative tendencies because they pursue the shadow of the sky from the water.

original: yang na rjes su zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na rjes su zhugs pa ste /
translated: Or they are called negative tendencies because they enter.

original: til rnams ni til mar lta bu'i phyir phra rgyas so //
analyzed: til rnams ni til mar lta bu'i phyir phra rgyas so //
translated: They are negative tendencies because they are like sesame oil in sesame seeds.

original: yang nye bar len pa'i phud po lnga rnams la dmigs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis rgyas par 'gyur bas phra rgyas so //
analyzed: yang nye bar len pa'i phud po lnga rnams la dmigs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis rgyas par 'gyur bas phra rgyas so //
translated: Or they are called negative tendencies because they increase through possessing the focal object of the five appropriated aggregates.

original: ci'i phyir rgyas par 'gyur ba zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rgyas par 'gyur ba zhe na /
translated: Why do they increase?

original: dmigs pa dang ldan pa gnyis kyis rtag par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ldan pa gnyis kyis rtag par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They increase through two things: the object field and the possession of the seeds.

original: de ltar phra rgyas bdun po khams dang tshul dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa de dag ni dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur te /üîΩ'dod pa na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu ste /
analyzed: de ltar phra rgyas bdun po khams dang tshul dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa de dag ni dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur te / 'dod pa na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu ste /
translated: The seven negative tendencies are differentiated by realm, mode, and aspect, and thus they are the eighty-eight negative tendencies.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / @273a * //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / @273a * //
translated: Ten are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering in the desire realm.üîΩThey are the afflicted view of the self,

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang /
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang /
translated: extreme view, wrong view, esteeming discipline and ritual as paramount, doubt, attachment, anger, pride,

original: ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'o //
translated: and ignorance.

original: kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang par bya ba bdun te ;
analyzed: kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang par bya ba bdun te ;
translated: Seven are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin.

original: de dag gi nang nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag gi nang nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: Among these, the afflicted view of the self, the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, and the esteeming of morality and asceticism are excluded.

original: 'gog pa mthong bas spang par bya ba bdun te /
analyzed: 'gog pa mthong bas spang par bya ba bdun te /
translated: Seven are to be abandoned by insight into cessation.

original: de dag nyid do //
analyzed: de dag nyid do //
translated: They are the same as the above.

original: lam mthong bas spang par bya ba brgyad do //
analyzed: lam mthong bas spang par bya ba brgyad do //
translated: Eight are to be abandoned by insight into the path.

original: bdun po de dag nyid dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bdun po de dag nyid dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: They are the seven above plus the esteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bzhi ste /
translated: Four are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: lta ba rnams dang the tshom ma gtogs te /
analyzed: lta ba rnams dang the tshom ma gtogs te /
translated: They are the afflicted views and doubt.

original: de ltar de dag ni 'dod par gtogs pa'i phra rgyas sum cu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni 'dod par gtogs pa'i phra rgyas sum cu rtsa drug go //
translated: Thus, there are thirty-six proclivities in the realm of desire.

original: gzugs kyi khams rnams ni de dag nyid las khong khro ba lnga ma gtogs so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams rnams ni de dag nyid las khong khro ba lnga ma gtogs so //
translated: In the realm of form, the same, excluding the five of anger.

original: gzugs med pa rnams na yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams na yang de bzhin te /
translated: In the formless realm, the same.

original: de dag ni dgu bcu rtsa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni dgu bcu rtsa brgyad yin no //
translated: Thus, there are ninety-eight.

original: de la de dag gcig tu bsdus nas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la de dag gcig tu bsdus nas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The eighty-eight that are included in the first two truths are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: bcu ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcu ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The ten that are included in the last two truths are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: khams rnams kyi sdug bsngal dang / rgyu mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba dang / ze tshom dang / dgu dang / de dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa dang ; ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa dang / de dag ni kun du 'gro bzhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams rnams kyi sdug bsngal dang / rgyu mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba dang / ze tshom dang / dgu dang / de dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa dang ; ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa dang / de dag ni kun du 'gro bzhes bya'o //
translated: The afflicted view of the self, the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, and the ignorance associated with them, and independent ignorance that is associated with the truth of suffering and the truth of origin in the desire realm and the first absorption are called pervasive.

original: lhag ma rnams ni kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The remaining ones are called nonpervasive.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang the tshom dang / de dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa dang / de dag ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang the tshom dang / de dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa dang / de dag ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa ste /
translated: Similarly, wrong view and doubt that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing the truths of cessation and path, the ignorance associated with them, and independent ignorance that is associated with the truth of cessation and the truth of path are called objects that focus on uncontaminated states.

original: 'gog pa dang / lam la dmigs pa dang / de gnyis kyang zag ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang / lam la dmigs pa dang / de gnyis kyang zag ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they focus on the truths of cessation and path, and because those two are uncontaminated.

original: lhag ma rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The remaining ones have contaminated objects.

original: de la gang dag zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa de dag ni /
analyzed: de la gang dag zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa de dag ni /
translated: Among them, those that have contaminated objects

original: dmigs pa dang ldan pa gnyis kyis rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ldan pa gnyis kyis rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: are increased by both possession and the object.

original: gang dag zag pa med pa la dmigs pa de dag ni ldan pas te rang gi tshogs rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag zag pa med pa la dmigs pa de dag ni ldan pas te rang gi tshogs rnams so //
translated: Those that have uncontaminated objects are increased by possession alone, that is, by their own group.

original: de bzhin du khams rnams kyi 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / the tshom dang / de dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa dang / ma rig pa 'ba' zhig pa dang / de dag ni 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams kyi 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / the tshom dang / de dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa dang / ma rig pa 'ba' zhig pa dang / de dag ni 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the view of annihilation, doubt, and the ignorance associated with them, and the ignorance that is not associated with those, which are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation of the elements, and the view of annihilation, doubt, and the ignorance associated with them, and the ignorance that is not associated with those, which are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of the path, have unconditioned objects.

original: lhag ma @273b rnams ni 'dus byas la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma @273b rnams ni 'dus byas la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The remaining ones have conditioned objects.

original: de dag 'byung ba'i go rims ni dang po kho nar ma rig pa dang ldan pas sems can bden pa rnams la rmongs te /
analyzed: de dag 'byung ba'i go rims ni dang po kho nar ma rig pa dang ldan pas sems can bden pa rnams la rmongs te /
translated: The order in which they arise is as follows. First, due to possessing ignorance, sentient beings are confused about the four truths.

original: de rnams sdug bsngal nas lam gyi bar de dag mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de rnams sdug bsngal nas lam gyi bar de dag mi 'dod do //
translated: They do not desire the truth of suffering up to the truth of the path.

original: de nas glen pa rnams yang dag pa dang / log pa'i phyogs gnyis thos nas 'di sdug bsngal yin nam /
analyzed: de nas glen pa rnams yang dag pa dang / log pa'i phyogs gnyis thos nas 'di sdug bsngal yin nam /
translated: Then, having heard about the right and wrong sides, the fools think, ‚ÄúIs this suffering?

original: 'di sdug bsngal ma yin pa la sogs pa'i the tshom skye'o //
analyzed: 'di sdug bsngal ma yin pa la sogs pa'i the tshom skye'o //
translated: Then, the fools, having heard the correct and incorrect positions, have doubts about whether this is suffering or not suffering, etc.

original: de nas dogs pa'i blos dman pa ma yin pa dang / bsten nas log par thos pa dang / log par sems pas nges par 'byung ste sbyin ba med do snyam pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas dogs pa'i blos dman pa ma yin pa dang / bsten nas log par thos pa dang / log par sems pas nges par 'byung ste sbyin ba med do snyam pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, with a doubting mind, they rely on the inferior and, having heard incorrectly and reflected incorrectly, they definitely emerge with the view that there is no generosity, etc.

original: de nas log par lta ba las 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas log par lta ba las 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'byung ste /
translated: Then, from the incorrect view, the view of the perishing aggregates arises.

original: des nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la sdug bsngal nyid bsal nas bdag tu mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: des nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la sdug bsngal nyid bsal nas bdag tu mngon par zhen to //
translated: By that, having eliminated the suffering of the five appropriated aggregates, they cling to the self.

original: de las mthar 'dzin par lta ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de las mthar 'dzin par lta ba 'byung ste /
translated: From that, the view grasping extremes arises.

original: des bdag chad pa dang / rtag pa mtha' gnyis bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bdag chad pa dang / rtag pa mtha' gnyis bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By that, the two extremes of annihilation and permanence of the self are grasped.

original: mthar 'dzin pa las tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mthar 'dzin pa las tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From the view grasping extremes, the view grasping at false views and ethics and modes of conduct as supreme arises.

original: mthar 'dzin pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis dag par yid ches so //
analyzed: mthar 'dzin pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis dag par yid ches so //
translated: One believes in purification through that very extreme view.

original: de las kyang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las kyang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From that, the overesteeming of mere morality and ritual arises.

original: gang gis dag par yid ches pa de la mchog tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: gang gis dag par yid ches pa de la mchog tu 'dzin to //
translated: One believes in purification through that very view and one overestimates it.

original: de'i 'og tu rang gi lta ba la 'dod chags skye'o //üîΩlta ba de nyid kyis kyang rlom sems su byed cing pha rol gyi lta ba'am /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rang gi lta ba la 'dod chags skye'o // lta ba de nyid kyis kyang rlom sems su byed cing pha rol gyi lta ba'am /
translated: After that, attachment to one's own view arises.

original: rang gi rgyud kyis sngon bzung ba las gtong ba dag la zhe sdang skye ste /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyis sngon bzung ba las gtong ba dag la zhe sdang skye ste /
translated: One becomes conceited through that very view and one generates aversion toward other views or toward the relinquishment of views previously held by oneself.

original: de dag gi go rims ni de lta'o //
analyzed: de dag gi go rims ni de lta'o //
translated: This is the order of the views.

original: nyon mongs pa re re yang rgyu gsum gsum las skye ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa re re yang rgyu gsum gsum las skye ste /
translated: Each of the afflictions arises from three causes.

original: gal te phra rgyas ma spangs pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang / yul nye bar gnas par gyur nas rgyu dang yul dang sbyor ba'i stobs de dag las nyon mongs pa skye'o //
analyzed: gal te phra rgyas ma spangs pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang / yul nye bar gnas par gyur nas rgyu dang yul dang sbyor ba'i stobs de dag las nyon mongs pa skye'o //
translated: If the negative tendencies are not abandoned, if there is incorrect mental attention, and if the object is present, then the afflictions arise from the power of the cause, the power of the object, and the power of application.

original: de dag ni lus dang sems kyi rgyu nyon mongs par byed pas nyon mongs pa rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni lus dang sems kyi rgyu nyon mongs par byed pas nyon mongs pa rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called afflictions because they afflict the body and mind.üîΩThey are afflictions because they afflict the body and mind.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams gang yin pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang yin mod kyis gnag dag de rnams las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can 'du byed kyi phung por bsdus pa de dag ni ye ba'i nyon mongs pha nyid
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams gang yin pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang yin mod kyis gnag dag de rnams las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can 'du byed kyi phung por bsdus pa de dag ni ye ba'i nyon mongs pha nyid
translated: They are called secondary afflictions upaklesa because they are similar to the afflictions.

original: do // de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: do // de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: sgyu dang / rgyags pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / @274a * //
analyzed: sgyu dang / rgyags pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / @274a * //
translated: They are deceit, arrogance, violence,üîΩenvy, avarice,üîΩerasure,üîΩresentment,üîΩdissimulation,

original: dus che ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / g-yo la sogs pa rnam pa du ma rgyud las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: dus che ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / g-yo la sogs pa rnam pa du ma rgyud las byung ba rnams so //
translated: and so on.

original: da la sgyu ni pha rol la slu ba'o //
analyzed: da la sgyu ni pha rol la slu ba'o //
translated: Deceit is the concealment of one's faults.

original: rgyags pa ni gzugs dang / lang tshe dang / rigs dang / tshul khrims dang / mang du thos pa la sogs pa rang gi chos rnams la chags te gzhan la mi ltos par sems yongs su gtugs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyags pa ni gzugs dang / lang tshe dang / rigs dang / tshul khrims dang / mang du thos pa la sogs pa rang gi chos rnams la chags te gzhan la mi ltos par sems yongs su gtugs pa'o //
translated: Arrogance is the inflation of the mind that occurs when one is attached to one's own qualities, such as beauty, health, nobility, morality, learning, etc., and does not respect others.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba ni lag pa dang / bong ba dang / dbyig pas brdeg pa dang / pha rol la tshig rtsub pos rnam par tho 'tshams pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba ni lag pa dang / bong ba dang / dbyig pas brdeg pa dang / pha rol la tshig rtsub pos rnam par tho 'tshams pa'o //
translated: Violence is the desire to harm others, to beat them with sticks, stones, fists, etc., and to torment them with harsh words.

original: dus che ba ni kha na ma thob dang bcas pa'i dngos po dam du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: dus che ba ni kha na ma thob dang bcas pa'i dngos po dam du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Greatness of mind is the desire to hold on to things that are not to be given away.

original: de'i dbang gis rigs par bsgo ba mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis rigs par bsgo ba mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Because of this, one does not accept reasonable advice.

original: khon du 'dzin pa ni kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po mang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa ni kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po mang du byed pa'o //
translated: Bearing a grudge is the desire to increase the basis of malice.

original: g-yo ni sems gya gyu ba ste /
analyzed: g-yo ni sems gya gyu ba ste /
translated: Guile is the crookedness of mind.

original: de'i dbang gis gzhan nas gzhan du brgyud cing gung du 'dren te /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis gzhan nas gzhan du brgyud cing gung du 'dren te /
translated: Because of this, one leads others on by devious paths,

original: gsal bar mi rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsal bar mi rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: and does not reveal one's true intentions.

original: de la de dag ni nang nas sgyu dang rgyags pa gnyis ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa 'dod chags kyi rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de la de dag ni nang nas sgyu dang rgyags pa gnyis ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa 'dod chags kyi rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: Among these, the two, deceit and arrogance, are concordant with desire, because they are the natural outcome of desire.

original: 'dod chags kyi rigs la brten zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rigs la brten zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are said to be based on the type of desire.

original: khon du 'dzin pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba ni khong khro ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba ni khong khro ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: Resentment and violence are concordant with anger.

original: dus che ba ni lta ba snyems pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: dus che ba ni lta ba snyems pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: Arrogance is the natural outcome of the view of the transitory collection.

original: g-yo ba ni log par lta ba'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni log par lta ba'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: Slyness is the natural outcome of false view.

original: gya gru ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gya gru ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is crooked?

original: sdig pa can gyi lta ba'o zhes tshigs su bcad pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi lta ba'o zhes tshigs su bcad pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: It is a sinful view.

original: kun nas dkris te 'dug pa ni bcu ste /
analyzed: kun nas dkris te 'dug pa ni bcu ste /
translated: There are ten entanglements:

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / ngo tsha med ba dang / khrel med pa dang / khro ba dang / 'chab pa'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / ngo tsha med ba dang / khrel med pa dang / khro ba dang / 'chab pa'o //
translated: sloth, sleep, excitation, regret, envy, avarice, lack of conscience, shamelessness, anger, and hypocrisy.

original: de la rmugs pa ni lus dang sems las su mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: de la rmugs pa ni lus dang sems las su mi rung ba ste /
translated: Among these, sloth is unserviceability of body and mind.

original: slong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: slong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term to beg means to ask.

original: gnyid ni lus dang sems 'dzin par mi nus pa dang / sems sdud pa ste /
analyzed: gnyid ni lus dang sems 'dzin par mi nus pa dang / sems sdud pa ste /
translated: Sleep is the inability of the body and mind to function, and the withdrawal of the mind.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa can nyid yin pas kun nas dkris te 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa can nyid yin pas kun nas dkris te 'dug pa'o //
translated: It is a defilement because it is a form of envelopment.

original: rgod pa ni sems ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rgod pa ni sems ma zhi ba'o //
translated: Excitement is the lack of calmness of the mind.

original: ngan par byas pa'i dngos po ni 'gyod pa'o //üîΩ'dir de la dmigs pa sems las byung ba'i chos la 'gyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ngan par byas pa'i dngos po ni 'gyod pa'o // 'dir de la dmigs pa sems las byung ba'i chos la 'gyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Regret is remorse about something that has been done wrongly.üîΩHere, it is a mental factor that has that as its object.

original: yid la gcags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid la gcags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called regret because it is a form of remorse.

original: rgyu la 'bras @274b bus btags te /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras @274b bus btags te /
translated: The cause is designated by the effect.

original: dper na mi sdug pa la dmigs pa'i chos la mi sdug ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mi sdug pa la dmigs pa'i chos la mi sdug ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a dharma that has inconstancy as its object is called inconstant.

original: 'jig rten na yang gnas kyis gnas pa ston te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang gnas kyis gnas pa ston te /
translated: In the world, the place is indicated by the resident.

original: dper na grong thams cad lhags so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na grong thams cad lhags so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the entire village has come.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa can nyid yin pas kun nas dkris te 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa can nyid yin pas kun nas dkris te 'dug pa'o //
translated: It is a defilement because it is a form of envelopment.

original: phrag dog dang ser sna'i mtshan nyid ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: phrag dog dang ser sna'i mtshan nyid ni bshad zin to //
translated: The characteristics of envy and avarice have already been explained.

original: ngo tsha med pa ni yon tan rnams dang / yon tan can rnams la mi gus pa ste /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa ni yon tan rnams dang / yon tan can rnams la mi gus pa ste /
translated: Shamelessness is disrespect for virtues and those who possess virtues.

original: gus pa'i gnyen po'i chos so //
analyzed: gus pa'i gnyen po'i chos so //
translated: It is the opposite of respect.

original: khrel med pa ni kha na ma thob la 'jigs par mi lta ba'o //
analyzed: khrel med pa ni kha na ma thob la 'jigs par mi lta ba'o //
translated: Lack of conscience is not seeing fear in what should be feared.

original: kha na ma tho ba ni gang dam pa rnams kyis smad pa ngan song du 'gro ba'o //üîΩkhro ba ni zhe sdang dang / rnam par 'tshe ba ma gtogs te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba ni gang dam pa rnams kyis smad pa ngan song du 'gro ba'o // khro ba ni zhe sdang dang / rnam par 'tshe ba ma gtogs te /
translated: What should be feared is that which is censured by the wise and leads to miserable realms.

original: sems can dang sems can ma yin pa dag la kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dang sems can ma yin pa dag la kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
translated: Anger is the desire to harm sentient beings, except for aversion and violence.

original: 'chab pa ni kha na ma thob mkhyud pa'o //
analyzed: 'chab pa ni kha na ma thob mkhyud pa'o //
translated: Concealment is hiding one's faults.

original: sems la kun nas dam du dkris te gnas pas kun nas dkris te 'dug pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems la kun nas dam du dkris te gnas pas kun nas dkris te 'dug pa rnams so //
translated: They are called entanglements because they entangle the mind and remain as entanglements.

original: de dag las rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / khrel med pa ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / khrel med pa ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: Among them, torpor, sleep, and lack of conscience are concordant with ignorance.

original: 'gyod pa ni tshom gyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni tshom gyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: Regret arises from doubt.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang / rgod pa dang / ser sna ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang / rgod pa dang / ser sna ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: Shamelessness, excitation, and stinginess are concordant with attachment.

original: khong khro ba dang phrag dog ni khong khro ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: khong khro ba dang phrag dog ni khong khro ba las byung ba'o //
translated: Anger and envy arise from anger.

original: 'chab ba ni sred pa dang ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'chab ba ni sred pa dang ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: Concealment is the natural outcome of craving and ignorance.

original: dri ma rnam pa bcu po de rnams kyang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dri ma rnam pa bcu po de rnams kyang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These ten defilements are called secondary defilements.

original: sems las byung ba rnams kyi rgyu phra ba ste /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams kyi rgyu phra ba ste /
translated: They are subtle causes of the defilements.

original: de rgyun du 'bab pa yang bye brag phyed par mi nus na skad cig rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de rgyun du 'bab pa yang bye brag phyed par mi nus na skad cig rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If it is impossible to distinguish their flow, what can be said of their moments?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i blo can dag gis ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i blo can dag gis ni /
translated: But the wise, who are skilled in the characteristics of the factors of existence as taught by the Lord,üîΩunderstand the faults of the defilements and their natural outcome,

original: de'i 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong bas de dag gi rigs bzhin skyon med par rtogs kyi /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong bas de dag gi rigs bzhin skyon med par rtogs kyi /
translated: because they see the difference in their results.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab 'chad pa'i slob dpon la bsnyen bkur ma byas pa 'khrul pa'i blo gros can dag gis ni ma yin no //üîΩde bzhin du /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab 'chad pa'i slob dpon la bsnyen bkur ma byas pa 'khrul pa'i blo gros can dag gis ni ma yin no //üîΩde bzhin du /
translated: But not the confused, who have not honored the masters who explain the Excellent Words of the Well-Gone One.

original: sgyu dang / dregs pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / khengs pa dang / g-yo la sogs pa dpag tu med pa dag bshad mod kyis gzhung @275a * //
analyzed: sgyu dang / dregs pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / khengs pa dang / g-yo la sogs pa dpag tu med pa dag bshad mod kyis gzhung @275a * //
translated: and so on, are explained as immeasurable.üîΩ

original: mangs su dogs pas 'dir ma spros so //
analyzed: mangs su dogs pas 'dir ma spros so //
translated: Although it is explained that there are immeasurable [other] afflictions, such as deceit, arrogance, violence, haughtiness, and guile, fearing excessive length, I will not elaborate on them here.

original: nyon mongs ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag gis kun du spags shing kun nas nyon mongs pas na kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag gis kun du spags shing kun nas nyon mongs pas na kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Since one is afflicted and completely afflicted by those afflictions and branch afflictions, it is complete affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de rnams shin tu mdzes pa'i rnams pa dang / phul du byung ba'i rnam pas bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa gang yin pa de ni /üîΩnyon mongs nye ba kun nyon mongs /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de rnams shin tu mdzes pa'i rnams pa dang / phul du byung ba'i rnam pas bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa gang yin pa de ni / nyon mongs nye ba kun nyon mongs /
translated: That which is the complete abandonment of those afflictions and branch afflictions together with their imprints by means of a very beautiful form and an excellent form isüîΩthe complete abandonment of all afflictions and branch afflictions

original: bag chags bcas par gtan spangs pa //üîΩzhes bya'o // thugs rje chen po dang shes rab dang thabs ni /
analyzed: bag chags bcas par gtan spangs pa // zhes bya'o // thugs rje chen po dang shes rab dang thabs ni /
translated: together with their imprints.üîΩGreat compassion, wisdom, and method are

original: snying rje che dang shes rab thabs //üîΩzhes bya ste /
analyzed: snying rje che dang shes rab thabs //üîΩzhes bya ste /
translated: great compassion, wisdom, and method.

original: de rnams kyis kun nas ma lus gsungs par 'gro ba'i don mtho ris dang / byang grol gyi mtshan can don yod cing 'bras bu dang bcas pa rten byed cing rdzogs par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kun nas ma lus gsungs par 'gro ba'i don mtho ris dang / byang grol gyi mtshan can don yod cing 'bras bu dang bcas pa rten byed cing rdzogs par mdzad pas na /
translated: He is the one who, by means of the ten powers, has fully and completely accomplished the benefit of beings, which is the benefit of the higher realms and the definite goodness of liberation.

original: don yod 'gro ba'i don byed pa //
analyzed: don yod 'gro ba'i don byed pa //
translated: He is the one who accomplishes the benefit of beings without fail.

original: zhes bya'o // mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni 'du shes te /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni 'du shes te /
translated: The grasping of signs is perception.

original: khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas thams cad du gtogs pa'i 'du shes thams cad ni 'du shes kun no //
analyzed: khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas thams cad du gtogs pa'i 'du shes thams cad ni 'du shes kun no //
translated: All perceptions that are included in the realms, destinies, and birthplaces are all perceptions.

original: 'du shes de rnams ni don spangs pa'i chos thams cad la bdag med pa'i ye shes 'dis sbong bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes de rnams ni don spangs pa'i chos thams cad la bdag med pa'i ye shes 'dis sbong bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: By means of this gnosis of selflessness in all phenomena, he has abandoned all those perceptions.

original: de nyid ni don te /
analyzed: de nyid ni don te /
translated: That is the meaning.

original: dgos pa gang yin yin pa de la /
analyzed: dgos pa gang yin yin pa de la /
translated: He is the one who has the meaning, the purpose.

original: 'du shes kun gyi don spangs pa //
analyzed: 'du shes kun gyi don spangs pa //
translated: He is the one who has abandoned the meaning of all perceptions.

original: zhes bya'o // rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid can ni rnam shes so //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid can ni rnam shes so //
translated: Consciousness is characterized by consciousness.

original: de'i don ni gzung bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i don ni gzung bar bya ba ste /
translated: Its meaning is the objects to be grasped.

original: yul rnams so //
analyzed: yul rnams so //
translated: They are the objects.

original: de'i 'gog pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'gog pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa'o //
translated: Its cessation is the non-arising by way of own-nature.

original: de byed cing rtogs par mdzad pas ni /
analyzed: de byed cing rtogs par mdzad pas ni /
translated: He is the one who makes that happen and realizes it.

original: rnam shes don ni 'gag par byed //
analyzed: rnam shes don ni 'gag par byed //
translated: He is the one who causes the cessation of the object of consciousness.

original: ces bya'o // 'du shes thams cad dang bral zhing gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i nye bar dmigs pa rnam par spangs su zin kyang don yod par 'gro ba rnams kyi don mdzad pas na /
analyzed: ces bya'o // 'du shes thams cad dang bral zhing gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i nye bar dmigs pa rnam par spangs su zin kyang don yod par 'gro ba rnams kyi don mdzad pas na /
translated: Even though he is free from all discriminations and has abandoned the apprehension of apprehended-object and apprehending-subject, he still acts for the sake of the world.

original: sems can kun yid yul dang ldan //
analyzed: sems can kun yid yul dang ldan //
translated: He is the one who has the object of the minds of all sentient beings.

original: sems can kun gyi yid rig pa //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid rig pa // zhes smos te /
translated: He is the one who knows the minds of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi yid kyi yul 'di la dmigs pa nyid kyis skal ba dang ldan pa dang / skal ba dang mi ldan pa nyid thugs su chud pa'i don gyis na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi yid kyi yul 'di la dmigs pa nyid kyis skal ba dang ldan pa dang / skal ba dang mi ldan pa nyid thugs su chud pa'i don gyis na /
translated: He is the one who has the object of the minds of all sentient beings because he understands the fortunate and the unfortunate by means of the object of observation of all sentient beings.

original: sems can kun @275b yid yul dang ldan //
analyzed: sems can kun @275b yid yul dang ldan //
translated: He is the one who has the object of the minds of all sentient beings.

original: zhes bya'o // chud du dang / 'bring dang / chen po la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid thugs su chud pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // chud du dang / 'bring dang / chen po la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid thugs su chud pas na /
translated: He is the one who knows the minds of all sentient beings because he understands the nature of the minds of sentient beings who are differentiated by means of the categories of small, medium, great, and so forth.

original: sems can kun gyi yid rig pa //üîΩzhes bya ste /üîΩrig pa dang / rtogs pa dang / khong du chad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid rig pa // zhes bya ste / rig pa dang / rtogs pa dang / khong du chad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He knows the minds of all living beings.

original: rnam grangs yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the terms ‚Äúknowledge,‚Äù ‚Äúrealization,‚Äù and ‚Äúpenetration‚Äù are synonyms.

original: gang 'di sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs su chud de /
analyzed: gang 'di sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs su chud de /
translated: The nature of the minds of all living beings is known by the Lord.

original: de lta mod kyi gzhan dag gi sems ni bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs las tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi gzhan dag gi sems ni bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs las tha dad pa yin na /
translated: However, the minds of others are different from the mind of the Lord.

original: don ji ltar rdzogs par 'gyur zhes kun du rtog pa la /
analyzed: don ji ltar rdzogs par 'gyur zhes kun du rtog pa la /
translated: How then is the aim fulfilled?

original: sems can kun gyi yod la gnas /
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yod la gnas /
translated: He abides in the minds of all living beings.

original: de dag sems dang mthun par 'jug / ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag sems dang mthun par 'jug / ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He acts in accordance with their minds.

original: de rnams kyi sems ni de dag sems so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sems ni de dag sems so //
translated: The minds of those are their minds.

original: de rnams kyi sems dang mthun pa ni mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sems dang mthun pa ni mnyam pa'o //
translated: Acting in accordance with their minds is acting in a way that is the same as their minds.

original: 'jug pa ni thob pa'o //üîΩdes na / sems can kun gyi yid la gnas //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni thob pa'o // des na / sems can kun gyi yid la gnas //
translated: Acting is obtaining.üîΩTherefore,

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: he abides in the minds of all living beings.

original: nang du song zhing gnyis su med par khong du chud pa'i rnam pas so sor snang ba skyes pas na /
analyzed: nang du song zhing gnyis su med par khong du chud pa'i rnam pas so sor snang ba skyes pas na /
translated: He is the one who has generated the appearance of the individual [phenomena].

original: de rnams kyi rang gi don ma tshang ba med par rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang gi don ma tshang ba med par rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is the one who has perfected the individual meanings without incompleteness.üîΩHe is the one who has abandoned the far-reaching thoughts of the distant.

original: thag ring bar rtog pa ring du spangs pa nyid kyis ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: thag ring bar rtog pa ring du spangs pa nyid kyis ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs par mdzad pas na /
translated: He is the one who has perfected the meaning of what is desired.

original: sems can thams cad kyi yid tshim par mdzad pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi yid tshim par mdzad pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas na /
translated: He is the one who has the nature of satisfying the minds of all sentient beings.

original: sems can kun yid tshim par byed //
analyzed: sems can kun yid tshim par byed //
translated: He is the one who satisfies the minds of all sentient beings.

original: ces bya'o // mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba chen po'i dga' ba skyed par mdzad bas na /
analyzed: ces bya'o // mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba chen po'i dga' ba skyed par mdzad bas na /
translated: He is the one who generates the joy of supreme delight and great bliss.

original: sems can kun gyi yid dga' ba //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid dga' ba //
translated: He is the one who delights the minds of all sentient beings.
