original: zhes bya'o / grub pa mthar phyin 'khrul pa med //
analyzed: zhes bya'o / grub pa mthar phyin 'khrul pa med //
translated: He is the one who has perfected the accomplishment and is free from error.

original: nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs //üîΩdon gsum the tshom med pa'i blos //
analyzed: nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs // don gsum the tshom med pa'i blos //
translated: He is the one who has abandoned all mistakes.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is the one who has the mind of certainty about the three meanings.

original: grub ba rnams kyi mtha' ni grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: grub ba rnams kyi mtha' ni grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The end of the accomplishments is the culmination of the accomplishments.

original: mthar thug pa de las gzhan pa'i lhag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa de las gzhan pa'i lhag pa med pa'o //
translated: It is the ultimate, since there is nothing higher than it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir 'khrul pa rnams dang bral ba'i rgyu gang gis na nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'khrul pa rnams dang bral ba'i rgyu gang gis na nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of freedom from error, since it is the complete abandonment of all error.

original: 'di ltar thams cad ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is it that it is all?

original: gang gi phyir the tshom med @276a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir the tshom med @276a * //
translated: Because it is the mind that is free from doubt.

original: pa'i blo zhes bya bas nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: pa'i blo zhes bya bas nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa yin la /
translated: Thus, it is the complete abandonment of all error.

original: nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs pas na 'khrul pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs pas na 'khrul pa med pa'o //
translated: And because it is the complete abandonment of all error, it is free from error.

original: de nyid kyis na grub pa'i mthar phyin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na grub pa'i mthar phyin zhes bya ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is said to be the culmination of the philosophical view.

original: gzhan rnams kyis grub pa'i mtha' ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags la sogs pa yod pas mthar thug par 'gro ba med pas na mthar phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyis grub pa'i mtha' ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags la sogs pa yod pas mthar thug par 'gro ba med pas na mthar phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: The philosophical views of others are not the culmination, since they do not go to the ultimate, because the latent afflictions and so on are not abandoned.

original: yang na grub pa'i mtha' ni 'dir phyogs 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: yang na grub pa'i mtha' ni 'dir phyogs 'jog pa ste /
translated: Or else, a philosophical view is a position.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid thugs su chud pa'i gnyis su med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyi don dam pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid thugs su chud pa'i gnyis su med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyi don dam pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of the Bhagavat is the nondual, nonconceptual intuition which penetrates the selflessness of all things.

original: de la 'khrul pa ni gzhung gzhan sna tshogs pa dag gis kun du bslang ba'i bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa rnams ni rnam pa sna tshogs par rig pas rnam par 'khor ba'i phyir 'khrul pa ste de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'khrul pa ni gzhung gzhan sna tshogs pa dag gis kun du bslang ba'i bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa rnams ni rnam pa sna tshogs par rig pas rnam par 'khor ba'i phyir 'khrul pa ste de dang bral ba'o //
translated: Therein, error refers to the various kinds of clinging to I and mine which are aroused by the various scriptures. It is error because of the various kinds of discursive thought that revolve around the world. It is free from error.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'khrul pa rnams las 'das par gyur pas na 'khrul pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa rnams las 'das par gyur pas na 'khrul pa med pa'o //
translated: Because it is beyond all error, it is nonerroneous.

original: de la rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang / tshogs pa las bdag dang bdag gi dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa po la sogs pa dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang /
analyzed: de la rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang / tshogs pa las bdag dang bdag gi dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa po la sogs pa dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang /
translated: Therein, the self, the possessor of self, the grasped, the grasper, etc., the aggregates, the elements, the sense-fields, etc., are all imagined to exist as substances, qualities, actions, universals, particulars, and collections.

original: gang zag la sogs pa ni nor pa'i bye brag gi phyogs snga ma nges par spangs pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag la sogs pa ni nor pa'i bye brag gi phyogs snga ma nges par spangs pa ste /
translated: The person, etc. are the former positions that are definitely abandoned as errors.

original: tshad mas bcom pa'i phyir rnam par spangs pa gang yin pa de ni nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: tshad mas bcom pa'i phyir rnam par spangs pa gang yin pa de ni nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: That which is abandoned by the valid cognition that has destroyed them is the complete abandonment of all errors.

original: the tshom med pa'i blo ni shes bya thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dri ma med pa'i blo gang yin pa de ni the tshom med pa'i blo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: the tshom med pa'i blo ni shes bya thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dri ma med pa'i blo gang yin pa de ni the tshom med pa'i blo zhes bya ste /
translated: The mind without doubt is the stainless mind that is the nature of the complete understanding of all objects of knowledge in every way. That is called the mind without doubt.

original: mi slub zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi slub zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means without deception.

original: gsum ni bud med de /
analyzed: gsum ni bud med de /
translated: The three are women.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom.

original: don ni dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: don ni dgongs pa ste /
translated: The meaning is the intention.

original: des kha na ma tho ba med par gzhan gyi don mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni don gsum mo //
analyzed: des kha na ma tho ba med par gzhan gyi don mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni don gsum mo //
translated: That which is the performance of the benefit of others without fault is the third meaning.

original: yang na don rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na don rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Or, the three meanings are

original: spang bar bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba dang btang snyoms su bya ba'o //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba dang btang snyoms su bya ba'o //
translated: what is to be abandoned, what is to be adopted, and what is to be left as it is.

original: de la spang bar bya ba ni phyi rol gyi mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la spang bar bya ba ni phyi rol gyi mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The things to be abandoned are the external ten nonvirtues and so on.

original: blang bar bya ba ni chos bdag med pa'i ye shes kyi chogs dang bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: blang bar bya ba ni chos bdag med pa'i ye shes kyi chogs dang bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: The things to be adopted are the accumulations of merit and knowledge, which are the causes of the knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: btang snyoms su bya ba ni lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: btang snyoms su bya ba ni lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: The things to be left as they are are the neutral phenomena.

original: 'di dag thams cad @276b ni gdul bya dang rjes su 'tsham pas na don de dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad @276b ni gdul bya dang rjes su 'tsham pas na don de dgongs pa'o //
translated: Since all of these are in accordance with the disciples, they are the meanings that are intended.

original: de gang la mnga' ba de ni don gsum mo //
analyzed: de gang la mnga' ba de ni don gsum mo //
translated: The one who possesses these three meanings is the one with the three meanings.

original: rnam pa thams cad du mkhyen pa nyid ni thams cad ces bya ba'i sgras bshad do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mkhyen pa nyid ni thams cad ces bya ba'i sgras bshad do //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is explained by the word all.

original: de las don thams cad pa gang yin pa de kun don te /
analyzed: de las don thams cad pa gang yin pa de kun don te /
translated: Among those, the one that is the meaning of all is the one with the meaning of all.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad kyi don du 'gyur zhing skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du thams cad cir 'gyur bas na kun don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad kyi don du 'gyur zhing skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du thams cad cir 'gyur bas na kun don to //
translated: Since it is the meaning of all, it is the one with the meaning of all, because it is the meaning of all, and because it is all that is to be known, just as it is.

original: yang na don med pa ni sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: yang na don med pa ni sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o //
translated: Alternatively, the meaningless is suffering and the cause of suffering.

original: don ni bde ba dang / bde ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: don ni bde ba dang / bde ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The meaning is happiness and the cause of happiness.

original: thams cad du bde ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa dang / bde ba thams cad ni rgyur gyur pas na kun don no //
analyzed: thams cad du bde ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa dang / bde ba thams cad ni rgyur gyur pas na kun don no //
translated: and all things are of the nature of bliss, and all bliss is the cause of that, it is the universal object.

original: snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa ni yon tan gsum ste /
analyzed: snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa ni yon tan gsum ste /
translated: The three qualities are goodness, activity, and darkness.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi bdag nyid can no //
translated: They have the nature of passion, aversion, and delusion.

original: de bzhin yang ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin yang ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: And likewise, it is the nature of intuition.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of disciplining those beings who are to be disciplined by passion, aversion, and delusion,

original: de'i bdag nyid can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na /
translated: it becomes the nature of the TathƒÅgata, who has that same nature.

analyzed: bdud 'dul ba dang / byang chub tu rnam par 'tshang rgya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ston pa rnams kyis sems can de dag yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: subjugating Mara, attaining perfect buddhahood, turning the wheel of Dharma, and manifesting great parinirvana. In this way he brings beings to full maturity.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul gyi yul tshad med pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul gyi yul tshad med pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva has an immeasurable domain of miracles.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul bya ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul bya ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva‚Äôs knowledge of magical emanations.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i zag pa zad pa'i shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i zag pa zad pa'i shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the bodhisattva‚Äôs knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants?

original: 'di dag ni zag pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni zag pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four contaminants:

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa dang / lta ba'i zag pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa dang / lta ba'i zag pa ste /
translated: They are the contaminant of desire, the contaminant of existence, the contaminant of ignorance, and the contaminant of views.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i zag pa zad pa de dag yongs su spangs pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i zag pa zad pa de dag yongs su spangs pa yin /
translated: The bodhisattvas have abandoned those contaminants and exhausted them.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni mi skye ba'i chos can du 'gyur zhing phyir mi skye mi 'gag ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni mi skye ba'i chos can du 'gyur zhing phyir mi skye mi 'gag ste /
translated: They will not arise in the future, and they will not arise again. They will not cease.

original: gdul ba ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la thams cad du skye ba yang ston pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam lhun gyis grub pas rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gdul ba ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la thams cad du skye ba yang ston pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam lhun gyis grub pas rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
translated: They manifest arising everywhere for sentient beings to be trained, just as is appropriate. This is called the bodhisattvas‚Äô uninterrupted engagement in the path through spontaneous accomplishment.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa drug go //
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa drug go //
translated: These are the six higher knowledges of the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa drug po de dag dang mngon par ldan zhing rtag tu mi 'bral te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa drug po de dag dang mngon par ldan zhing rtag tu mi 'bral te /
translated: The bodhisattva is endowed with these six higher knowledges and never separated from them.

original: de bas na mngon shes drug ldan no //
analyzed: de bas na mngon shes drug ldan no //
translated: Therefore, he is called the one endowed with the six higher knowledges.

original: rjes dran drug ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: rjes dran drug ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: The six recollections are the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dharma, the recollection of the Sa·πÖgha, the recollection of morality, the recollection of renunciation, and the recollection of the deities.

original: de rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni sngar bshad pas 'dir yang ma bshad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni sngar bshad pas 'dir yang ma bshad do //
translated: Since their intrinsic natures have already been explained, they will not be explained here.

original: rtag tu phyin ci ma log pa'i rjes su dran pa drug dang ldan pas na rjes su dran pa drug ces bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu phyin ci ma log pa'i rjes su dran pa drug dang ldan pas na rjes su dran pa drug ces bya'o //
translated: He is called the one with the six recollections because he always has the six recollections that are free from error.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bodhisattva, the great being.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems gang la yod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems gang la yod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is the one who has the thought of awakening.

original: de nyid gcig tu gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa ni sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid gcig tu gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa ni sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: He is a great being because he is engaged in the welfare of others.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa'i bdag nyid can gyi sems ni byang @287a * //üîΩchub sems dpa'o //üîΩkun tu 'gro ba'i chos kyi dbyings thugs su chud nas mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa'i bdag nyid can gyi sems ni byang @287a * // chub sems dpa'o // kun tu 'gro ba'i chos kyi dbyings thugs su chud nas mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: Again, the mind of the bodhisattva is the bodhisattva.üîΩHe is a great being because he has realized the ultimate realm, which is omnipresent.

original: rnam pa thams cad du yul che pa'i rdzu 'phrul brnyes pas na rdzu 'phrul chen po'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yul che pa'i rdzu 'phrul brnyes pas na rdzu 'phrul chen po'o //
translated: He is a great wonder because he has attained the great object, that is, the great superknowledge.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thugs su chud pas na 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thugs su chud pas na 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: Similarly, he is supramundane because he has realized supramundane intuition.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa'i mtha' //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa'i mtha' //
translated: The end of the perfection of wisdom

original: zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mngon par ldan pa'i chos kyi sku thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mngon par ldan pa'i chos kyi sku thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: is the realization of the Dharma Body endowed with the perfection of wisdom.üîΩHe is the essence of wisdom because he has become the very essence of that.üîΩHe has attained the very essence of wisdom

original: rnam pa thams cad du de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na /üîΩshes rab kyi ni de nyid thob //üîΩces bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na /üîΩshes rab kyi ni de nyid thob //üîΩces bya ba ste /
translated: because he has become the very essence of that.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i de kho na nyid ni dri ma med pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i de kho na nyid ni dri ma med pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The reality of the perfection of wisdom is stainless thusness.

original: de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin ni chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can yin pas na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin ni chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can yin pas na /
translated: Since the nature of reality is the nature of the dharmakƒÅya,

original: sems la sems shes pa med do zhes brtag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sems la sems shes pa med do zhes brtag par mi bya ste /
translated: one should not imagine that the mind is not aware of the mind.

original: sbyor ba bstan pas na spyi las spyi khas blang par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba bstan pas na spyi las spyi khas blang par bya ba yin no //
translated: Since the application is taught, the general should be accepted from the general.

original: yang na 'di ni nye bar gzhag pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni nye bar gzhag pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Or, this is merely a presentation,

original: de la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: but one should not cling to it.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin yang bdag dang gzhan gyi dbye bas tha snyad du bya ba bden pa gnyis kyi dbang du ston par mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin yang bdag dang gzhan gyi dbye bas tha snyad du bya ba bden pa gnyis kyi dbang du ston par mdzad pa ni /
translated: In order to teach this, although it is the essence of the perfection of wisdom, it is conventionally designated as self and other, and the teacher teaches from the perspective of the two truths.üîΩThe verse says:

original: bdag rig gzhan rig thams cad pa /
analyzed: bdag rig gzhan rig thams cad pa /
translated: Self-aware, aware of others, all-pervading,

original: kun la phan pa'i gang zag mchog / ces bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: kun la phan pa'i gang zag mchog / ces bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The supreme person who benefits all.

original: de la so sor rang gi rig pa'i chos nyid kyi tshul gyis na bdag rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la so sor rang gi rig pa'i chos nyid kyi tshul gyis na bdag rig pa'o //
translated: It is self-cognizant, in the sense of being the intrinsic reality of self-awareness.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyis na gdul bya rnams la khong du chud par mdzad pa'i phyir gzhan rig go //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyis na gdul bya rnams la khong du chud par mdzad pa'i phyir gzhan rig go //
translated: It is cognizant of others, in the sense of causing those to be disciplined to understand, by means of the illusory nature of mind.

original: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid chos kyi dbyings su bye brag med pas na thams cad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid chos kyi dbyings su bye brag med pas na thams cad pa'o //
translated: It is all-inclusive, in the sense of being the realm of totality, which is the intrinsic reality of all things, both moving and unmoving.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba rdzogs par mdzad pas na kun la phan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba rdzogs par mdzad pas na kun la phan pa'o //
translated: It is beneficial to all, in the sense of bringing about the perfect benefit and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi gtso bo'i skyes bu yin pas na gang zag mchog ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi gtso bo'i skyes bu yin pas na gang zag mchog ste /
translated: It is the supreme person, in the sense of being the chief person of all sentient beings.

original: rigs pa can gyis brtags pa'i gang zag ni ma yin te /üîΩde ni rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa can gyis brtags pa'i gang zag ni ma yin te / de ni rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the person imagined by the logicians,üîΩbecause that person does not exist in any way.

original: dper bya kun las 'das pa ste //
analyzed: dper bya kun las 'das pa ste //
translated: It is beyond all analogies.

original: shes dang shes bya'i bdag po mchog / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: shes dang shes bya'i bdag po mchog / ces bya ba la /
translated: It is the supreme lord of knowledge and the known.

original: cung zad tsam gyi mnyam pa yang med pa rnam pa thams cad du dper bya ba thams cad las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: cung zad tsam gyi mnyam pa yang med pa rnam pa thams cad du dper bya ba thams cad las 'das pa yin no //
translated: There is not even a slight equality, and it is beyond all examples in every way.

original: de bzhin @287b gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid du gyur pas shes pa zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin @287b gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid du gyur pas shes pa zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: It is also explained as ‚Äúknowledge‚Äù because it is the nature of all tathƒÅgatas.

original: legs pa 'dod pa rnams kyi mtho ris dang / thar pa'i rgyur gyur pas na de nyid ni mi shes par bya ba dang bsam par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: legs pa 'dod pa rnams kyi mtho ris dang / thar pa'i rgyur gyur pas na de nyid ni mi shes par bya ba dang bsam par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Since it is the cause of the heavens and liberation for those who desire excellence, it is the only thing to be known and contemplated.

original: de las gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is nothing other than that.

original: de kho na nyid kyi ye shes ma lus par byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bdag po'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi ye shes ma lus par byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bdag po'o //
translated: It is the lord of omniscient knowledge because it is the cause of the arising of all the knowledge of reality.

original: thams cad las phul du byung bas na mchog go //
analyzed: thams cad las phul du byung bas na mchog go //
translated: It is supreme because it is the best of all.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni sbyin pa thams cad kyi gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni sbyin pa thams cad kyi gtso bo yin la /
translated: The gift of Dharma is the foremost of all gifts.

original: de stsol bar mdzad pa'i phyir /üîΩgtso bo chos kyi sbyin bdag ste //
analyzed: de stsol bar mdzad pa'i phyir / gtso bo chos kyi sbyin bdag ste //
translated: Since it bestows that,

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: it is the foremost giver of the gift of Dharma.

original: sbyin bdag rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyin bdag rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is the best of benefactors.

original: phyag rgya bzhi po'i don ston pa //
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi po'i don ston pa //
translated: The meaning of the four seals.

original: zhes bya ba la phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / chos kyi phyag rgya dang / las kyi phyag rgya ni phyag rgya bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / chos kyi phyag rgya dang / las kyi phyag rgya ni phyag rgya bzhi ste /
translated: The four seals are the great seal, the pledge seal, the doctrine seal, and the action seal.

original: de rnams kyi don ni phyag rgya bzhi po'i don ston pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi don ni phyag rgya bzhi po'i don ston pa'o //
translated: The meaning of those is the meaning of the four seals.

original: de la phyag rgya chen po ni lha dang rjes su mthun par byed pa yin pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de la phyag rgya chen po ni lha dang rjes su mthun par byed pa yin pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: Therein, the great seal is the enjoyment body, since it is the conformity with the deity.

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni thugs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas so so rang gi rig pa'i chos sku'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni thugs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas so so rang gi rig pa'i chos sku'o //
translated: The pledge seal is the reality body of individual intuitive awareness, since it is the essence of the mind.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya ni chos kyi longs spyod kyi byin gyis brlabs las chos kyi de kho na nyid ston pa'i gsang sngags kyi yi ge'i bdag nyid can sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya ni chos kyi longs spyod kyi byin gyis brlabs las chos kyi de kho na nyid ston pa'i gsang sngags kyi yi ge'i bdag nyid can sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: The doctrine seal is the various seed syllables of the secret mantra which teach the reality of the doctrine, from the consecration of the enjoyment of the doctrine.

original: las kyi phyag rgya ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas sprul pa'i mdzad pa sna tshogs rdzogs par byed pa sprul pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas sprul pa'i mdzad pa sna tshogs rdzogs par byed pa sprul pa'i sku ste /
translated: The karmamudra is the nirmanakaya, which is the nature of the accomplishment of activities and which perfects the various emanated deeds.

original: phyag rgya bzhi po de dag gis don ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi po de dag gis don ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: These four mudras are the means of teaching the meaning.

original: gang gi phyir nyes pa thams cad las 'das shing yon tan thams cad kyi rang bzhin can yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyes pa thams cad las 'das shing yon tan thams cad kyi rang bzhin can yin la /
translated: Because it is beyond all faults and is the nature of all good qualities,

original: thar pa thams cad dang phun sum tshogs pa thams cad skyed par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: thar pa thams cad dang phun sum tshogs pa thams cad skyed par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: it gives rise to all liberation and all excellence.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'gro ba'i bsnyen bkur gnas kyi mchog / ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bsnyen bkur gnas kyi mchog / ces bya'o //
translated: it is the supreme object of the world's veneration.

original: nges 'byung gsum po bgrod rnams kyi //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nges 'byung gsum po bgrod rnams kyi // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For those who travel the three paths of definite emergence,

original: khyad par du 'gro ba rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi nges par 'byung ba la ma gtogs pa la gzhan ma dag gis nges par 'byung ba 'thob mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi nges par 'byung ba la ma gtogs pa la gzhan ma dag gis nges par 'byung ba 'thob mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is taught in order to demonstrate that those who progress to a special state, that is, the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and perfect buddhas, will definitely attain liberation through their respective paths of definite emergence, and that it is impossible to attain liberation through any other means.

original: nges 'byung gsum po bgrod rnams kyi //
analyzed: nges 'byung gsum po bgrod rnams kyi //
translated: The three kinds of renunciation are the paths of those who are to be liberated.

original: zhes bya ba la de'i dngos po gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de'i dngos po gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reality of that?

original: 'gro ba'i bsnyen bkur gnas kyi mchog tu gyur pa rje btsun 'jam dpal lo //üîΩde nyid ni dpal dang @288a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bsnyen bkur gnas kyi mchog tu gyur pa rje btsun 'jam dpal lo // de nyid ni dpal dang @288a * //
translated: It is the venerable Manjusri, who is the supreme object of veneration for the world.

original: ldan pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: ldan pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: He is the supreme glory.

original: ji ltar shes she na /üîΩdon gyi dam pa rnam dag dpal //
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na / don gyi dam pa rnam dag dpal //
translated: How is that known?

original: zhes gsungs pa las shes so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa las shes so //
translated: It is known from the statement:üîΩThe glory of the highest truth is pure.

original: de dag kyang 'jig rten gsum gyi skal ba bzang po nyid du gyur pas thams cad kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad yang dag par rdzogs par mdzad pas na dpal ldan 'byor pa kun byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'jig rten gsum gyi skal ba bzang po nyid du gyur pas thams cad kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad yang dag par rdzogs par mdzad pas na dpal ldan 'byor pa kun byed pa'o //
translated: And he is the glory of all prosperity, since he is the good fortune of the three worlds, and he is the bestower of all prosperity, since he perfectly accomplishes all the aims of everyone.

original: de bas na 'gro ba rnams kyis nges par 'byung ba gsum bgrod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'gro ba rnams kyis nges par 'byung ba gsum bgrod par byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, he is the one who causes the three kinds of renunciation to be traversed by the world.

original: de nyid gcig pu ni 'gro ba rnams kyis bsnyen bkur byed pa'i gnas kyi mchog yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid gcig pu ni 'gro ba rnams kyis bsnyen bkur byed pa'i gnas kyi mchog yin gyi /
translated: He alone is the supreme object of veneration for the world.

original: de las gzhan med do zhes nges par byas pa yin te ;
analyzed: de las gzhan med do zhes nges par byas pa yin te ;
translated: There is no other than that.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa yang de nyid yin no zhes nges par gzung ba la yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa yang de nyid yin no zhes nges par gzung ba la yang nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in ascertaining that it is also the very essence of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: da ni mtshan nyid kyi don thams cad nye bar bsdu ba'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das de rnam pa thams cad du mchod par 'os pa yin no zhes ston cing mtshan thams cad don ji lta ba nyid du bden pa'i mtshan nyid yin par khong du chud par
